data.name: AAPTManifestError
data.value:
{0}.
This error is likely caused by an issue with the AndroidManifest.xml file or an Android manifest generation attribute in a source code file.
data.comment: {0} - The error message returned by the AAPT or AAPT2 tool

data.name: APT0001
data.value: Unknown option `{0}`. Please check `$(AndroidAapt2CompileExtraArgs)` and `$(AndroidAapt2LinkExtraArgs)` to see if they include any `aapt` command line arguments that are no longer valid for `aapt2` and ensure that all other arguments are valid for `aapt2`.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: `aapt`, `aapt2`, `$(AndroidAapt2CompileExtraArgs)`, `$(AndroidAapt2LinkExtraArgs)` {0} - The invalid option name

data.name: APT0002
data.value: Invalid file name: It must contain only {0}.
data.comment: {0} - The regular expression that the file name must match

data.name: APT0003
data.value: Invalid file name: It must contain only {0}.
data.comment: {0} - The regular expression that the file name must match

data.name: APT0004
data.value: Invalid file name: It must start with A-z or a-z or an underscore.

data.name: XA0000_API_for_TargetFrameworkVersion
data.value: Could not determine API level for $(TargetFrameworkVersion) of '{0}'.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: $(TargetFrameworkVersion) {0} - The current value of $(TargetFrameworkVersion)

data.name: XA0000_API_or_TargetFrameworkVersion_Fail
data.value: Could not determine $(AndroidApiLevel) or $(TargetFrameworkVersion); should not be reached.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: $(AndroidApiLevel), $(TargetFrameworkVersion) In this message, the phrase "should not be reached" means that this error message is not expected to appear in normal usage.

data.name: XA0000_Exception
data.value: Unhandled exception: {0}
data.comment: {0} - The exception message of the associated exception

data.name: XA0000_TargetFrameworkVersion_for_API
data.value: Could not determine $(TargetFrameworkVersion) for API level '{0}.'
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: $(TargetFrameworkVersion) {0} - The API level number

data.name: XA0001
data.value: Unsupported or invalid $(TargetFrameworkVersion) value of '{0}'. Please update your Project Options.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: $(TargetFrameworkVersion)

data.name: XA0002
data.value: Could not find mono.android.jar
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: mono.android.jar

data.name: XA0003
data.value: Invalid `android:versionCode` value `{0}` in `AndroidManifest.xml`. It must be an integer value.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: `android:versionCode`, `AndroidManifest.xml`

data.name: XA0004
data.value: Invalid `android:versionCode` value `{0}` in `AndroidManifest.xml`. The value must be in the range of 0 to {1}.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: `android:versionCode`, `AndroidManifest.xml` {0} - The current value {1} - The maximum allowed value

data.name: XA0030
data.value: Building with JDK version `{0}` is not supported. Please install JDK version `{1}`. See https://aka.ms/xamarin/jdk9-errors
data.comment: The abbreviation "JDK" should not be translated.

data.name: XA0031
data.value: Java SDK {0} or above is required when using {1}. Download the latest JDK at: https://aka.ms/msopenjdk Note: the Android Designer is incompatible with Java SDK 11.0: https://aka.ms/vs2019-and-jdk-11
data.comment: {0} - The Java SDK version number {1} - The feature being used: `$(TargetFrameworkVersion) v10.0`

data.name: XA0031_NET
data.value: Java SDK {0} or above is required when using .NET 6 or higher. Download the latest JDK at: https://aka.ms/msopenjdk
data.comment: {0} - The Java SDK version number

data.name: XA0032
data.value: Java SDK {0} or above is required when using Android SDK Build-Tools {1}.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: Android SDK Build-Tools {0} - The Java SDK version number {1} - The Android SDK Build-Tools version number

data.name: XA0033
data.value: Failed to get the Java SDK version because the returned value does not appear to contain a valid version number. `{0} -version` returned: ```{1}```
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: `{0} -version`, ```{1}``` {0} - The name of the Java command {1} - The output of the command

data.name: XA0034
data.value: Failed to get the Java SDK version. Please ensure you have Java {0} or above installed.
data.comment: {0} - The Java version number

data.name: XA0035
data.value: Unable to determine the Android ABI from the value '{0}'. Edit the project file in a text editor and set the 'RuntimeIdentifiers' MSBuild property to contain only valid identifiers for the Android platform.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: Android, ABI, RuntimeIdentifiers, MSBuild {0} - The $(RuntimeIdentifier) supplied by the user.

data.name: XA0036
data.value: The 'AndroidSupportedAbis' MSBuild property is no longer supported. Edit the project file in a text editor, remove any uses of 'AndroidSupportedAbis', and use the 'RuntimeIdentifiers' MSBuild property instead.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: AndroidSupportedAbis, MSBuild, RuntimeIdentifiers

data.name: XA0100
data.value: EmbeddedNativeLibrary '{0}' is invalid in Android Application projects. Please use AndroidNativeLibrary instead.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: EmbeddedNativeLibrary, AndroidNativeLibrary {0} - The library name.

data.name: XA0104
data.value: Invalid value for `$(AndroidSequencePointsMode)`: {0}
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: `$(AndroidSequencePointsMode)`

data.name: XA0105
data.value: The $(TargetFrameworkVersion) for {0} ({1}) is greater than the $(TargetFrameworkVersion) for the application project ({2}). Please increase the $(TargetFrameworkVersion) for the application project.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: $(TargetFrameworkVersion) {0} - The file name of the library referenced by the application {1} - The target framework version number for the library {2} - The target framework version number for the application project

data.name: XA0107
data.value: {0} is a Reference Assembly.

data.name: XA0107_Ignoring
data.value: Ignoring Reference Assembly `{0}`.
data.comment: {0} - File name of the assembly.

data.name: XA0108
data.value: Could not get version from '{0}'. Defaulting to 1.0
data.comment: {0} - The tool name

data.name: XA0111
data.value: Unsupported version of AAPT2 found at path '{0}'. Open the project file in a text editor and remove the 'Aapt2ToolPath' MSBuild property or ensure it is set to a valid location.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: AAPT2, Aapt2ToolPath, MSBuild

data.name: XA0112
data.value: AAPT2 was not found at path '{0}'. Open the project file in a text editor and remove the 'Aapt2ToolPath' MSBuild property or ensure it is set to a valid location.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: AAPT2, Aapt2ToolPath, MSBuild

data.name: XA0113
data.value: Google Play requires that new applications and updates must use a TargetFrameworkVersion of {0} (API level {1}) or above. You are currently targeting {2} (API level {3}).
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: TargetFrameworkVersion {0} - The required minimum TargetFrameworkVersion, such as 'v10.0' {1} - The required minimum API level number, such as '29' {2} - The specified TargetFrameworkVersion {3} - The specified API level number

data.name: XA0116
data.value: Unable to find `EmbeddedResource` named `{0}`.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: EmbeddedResource {0} - The name of the missing resource

data.name: XA0117
data.value: The TargetFrameworkVersion {0} is deprecated. Please update it to be v5.0 or higher.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: TargetFrameworkVersion, v5.0 {0} - The current value of TargetFrameworkVersion

data.name: XA0118_Parse
data.value: Could not parse '{0}'
data.comment: {0} - A NuGet target framework moniker string

data.name: XA0118_Target
data.value: Could not resolve `target` in lock file for '{0}'
data.comment:
The following are literal names and should not be translated: `target`
The term "lock file" comes from NuGet. For example, search for "UnauthorizedLockFail" in https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Build.Localization to see some example localizations of "lock file."
{0} - A NuGet target framework moniker string

data.name: XA0119_AAB
data.value: Using Fast Deployment and Android App Bundles at the same time is not currently supported. Use Fast Deployment for Debug configurations and Android App Bundles for Release configurations.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: Android App Bundles

data.name: XA0119_AOT
data.value: Using fast deployment and AOT at the same time is not recommended. Use fast deployment for Debug configurations and AOT for Release configurations.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: AOT, Debug, Release.

data.name: XA0119_LinkMode
data.value: Using fast deployment and the linker at the same time is not recommended. Use fast deployment for Debug configurations and the linker for Release configurations.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: Debug, Release.

data.name: XA0119_LinkTool
data.value: Using fast deployment and a code shrinker at the same time is not recommended. Use fast deployment for Debug configurations and a code shrinker for Release configurations.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: Debug, Release.

data.name: XA0119_Interpreter
data.value: Disabling the interpreter; using the interpreter and AOT at the same time is not supported. Use the interpreter for hot reload support in Debug configurations and AOT for Release configurations.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: AOT, Debug, Release.

data.name: XA0121
data.value: Assembly '{0}' is using '[assembly: {1}]', which is no longer supported. Use a newer version of this NuGet package or notify the library author.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: [assembly: {1}], NuGet {0} - The assembly name {1} - The unsupported attribute

data.name: XA0122
data.value: Assembly '{0}' is using a deprecated attribute '[assembly: {1}]'. Use a newer version of this NuGet package or notify the library author.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: [assembly: {1}], NuGet

data.name: XA0123
data.value: Removing {0} from {1}. Lint {2} does not support this check.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: Lint When it appears in the middle of a sentence, "lint" is not capitalized. {0} - The literal name of a lint check, such as HardcodedDebugMode {1} - The literal name of the MSBuild property {2} - The lint version number

data.name: XA0125
data.value: '{0}' is using a deprecated debug information level. Set the debugging information to Portable in the Visual Studio project property pages or edit the project file in a text editor and set the 'DebugType' MSBuild property to 'portable' to use the newer, cross-platform debug information level. If this file comes from a NuGet package, update to a newer version of the NuGet package or notify the library author.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: 'DebugType', 'portable' The capitalized word "Portable" that appears earlier in the message is plain text and should be translated, but the lowercase word "portable" later in the message is a literal value and should not be translated. {0} - The file name of a deprecated symbol file

data.name: XA1000
data.value: There was a problem parsing {0}. This is likely due to incomplete or invalid XML. Exception: {1}
data.comment: {0} - The file name {1} - The exception message of the associated exception

data.name: XA1001
data.value: AndroidResgen: Warning while updating resource XML '{0}': {1}
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: AndroidResgen {0} - The name of the XML file {1} - The exception message of the associated exception

data.name: XA1002
data.value: The closest match found for '{0}' is '{1}', but the capitalization does not match. Please correct the capitalization.
data.comment: {0} - The user-provided type name {1} - The type name found

data.name: XA1005
data.value: Attempting basic type name matching for element with ID '{0}' and type '{1}'
data.comment: {0} - The Android resource ID name

data.name: XA1005_Instructions
data.value: If basic type name matching fails, please add a `xamarin:managedType` attribute to the element to specify the fully qualified managed type name of the element.
data.comment: "xamarin:managedType" is a literal name and should not be translated.

data.name: XA1006
data.value: The TargetFrameworkVersion (Android API level {0}) is higher than the targetSdkVersion ({1}). Please increase the `android:targetSdkVersion` in the `AndroidManifest.xml` so that the API levels match.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: targetSdkVersion, TargetFrameworkVersion, android:targetSdkVersion, AndroidManifest.xml {0} - The target framework version number {1} - The target SDK version number

data.name: XA1007
data.value: The minSdkVersion ({0}) is greater than the targetSdkVersion. Please change the value such that the minSdkVersion is less than or equal to the targetSdkVersion ({1}).
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: minSdkVersion, targetSdkVersion {0} - The minimum SDK version number {1} - The target SDK version number

data.name: XA1008
data.value: The TargetFrameworkVersion (Android API level {0}) is lower than the targetSdkVersion ({1}). Please increase the `$(TargetFrameworkVersion)` or decrease the `android:targetSdkVersion` in the `AndroidManifest.xml` so that the API levels match.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: targetSdkVersion, TargetFrameworkVersion, android:targetSdkVersion, AndroidManifest.xml {0} - The target framework version number {1} - The target SDK version number

data.name: XA1010
data.value: Invalid `$(AndroidManifestPlaceholders)` value for Android manifest placeholders. Please use `key1=value1;key2=value2` format. The specified value was: `{0}`
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: `$(AndroidManifestPlaceholders)`

data.name: XA1011
data.value: Using ProGuard with the D8 DEX compiler is no longer supported. Please set the code shrinker to 'r8' in the Visual Studio project property pages or edit the project file in a text editor and set the 'AndroidLinkTool' MSBuild property to 'r8'.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: ProGuard, D8, DEX, 'r8', 'AndroidLinkTool'

data.name: XA1012
data.value: Included layout root element override ID '{0}' is not valid.
data.comment: {0} - The Android resource ID name

data.name: XA1013
data.value: Failed to parse ID of node '{0}' in the layout file '{1}'.
data.comment: {0} - The Android resource XML element name {1} - The path of the layout file

data.name: XA1014
data.value: JAR library references with identical file names but different contents were found: {0}. Please remove any conflicting libraries from EmbeddedJar, InputJar and AndroidJavaLibrary.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: JAR, EmbeddedJar, InputJar and AndroidJavaLibrary {0} - Comma-separated list of the conflicting JAR library file names

data.name: XA1015
data.value: More than one Android Wear project is specified as the paired project. It can be at most one.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: Android Wear

data.name: XA1016
data.value: Target Wear application's project '{0}' does not specify required 'AndroidManifest' project property.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: Wear, AndroidManifest "Wear" is a short version of the full product name "Wear OS" and so should not be translated. {0} - The project file name

data.name: XA1017
data.value: Target Wear application's AndroidManifest.xml does not specify required 'package' attribute.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: Wear, AndroidManifest.xml, 'package' "Wear" is a short version of the full product name "Wear OS" and so should not be translated.

data.name: XA1018
data.value: Specified AndroidManifest file does not exist: {0}.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: AndroidManifest {0} - The path of the specified AndroidManifest file

data.name: XA1019
data.value: `LibraryProjectProperties` file `{0}` is located in a parent directory of the bindings project's intermediate output directory. Please adjust the path to use the original `project.properties` file directly from the Android library project directory.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: LibraryProjectProperties, project.properties, Android In this message, the term "binding" means a piece of generated code that makes it easy to access an Android API written in Java from a Xamarin.Android project written in C# or F#. {0} - The path of the LibraryProjectProperties file

data.name: XA1020
data.value: At least one Java library is required for binding. Check that a Java library is included in the project and has the appropriate build action: 'LibraryProjectZip' (for AAR or ZIP), 'EmbeddedJar', 'InputJar' (for JAR), or 'LibraryProjectProperties' (project.properties).
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: LibraryProjectZip, EmbeddedJar, InputJar, LibraryProjectProperties, project.properties

data.name: XA1021
data.value: Specified source Java library not found: {0}
data.comment: In this message, the term "source Java library" refers to the library that will be processed. In this case, the term "source" does not refer to "source code." {0} - The file name of the library

data.name: XA1022
data.value: Specified reference Java library not found: {0}
data.comment: In this message, the term "reference Java library" refers to a library that is included as a reference so that types from the library can be resolved during the build process. {0} - The file name of the library

data.name: XA1023
data.value: Using the DX DEX Compiler is not supported. Please set the DEX compiler to 'd8' in the Visual Studio project property pages or edit the project file in a text editor and set the 'AndroidDexTool' MSBuild property to 'd8'.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: DX, DEX, d8, AndroidDexTool.

data.name: XA1024
data.value: Ignoring configuration file '{0}'. .NET configuration files are not supported in Xamarin.Android projects that target .NET 6 or higher.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: .NET, Xamarin.Android. {0} - The file name such as 'Foo.dll.config'

data.name: XA1025
data.value: The experimental 'Hybrid' value for the 'AndroidAotMode' MSBuild property is not currently compatible with the armeabi-v7a target ABI. To continue using the experimental 'Hybrid' value for 'AndroidAotMode', deselect the armeabi-v7a target ABI in the Visual Studio project property pages or edit the project file in a text editor and remove 'armeabi-v7a' from the 'AndroidSupportedAbis' MSBuild property.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: 'Hybrid', 'AndroidAotMode', armeabi-v7a, 'AndroidSupportedAbis'

data.name: XA1026
data.value: Using AAPT is deprecated in favor of AAPT2. Please enable 'Use incremental Android packaging system (aapt2)' in the Visual Studio project property pages or edit the project file in a text editor and set the 'AndroidUseAapt2' MSBuild property to 'true'.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: AAPT, AAPT2, Android, AndroidUseAapt2, true.

data.name: XA1026_dotnet
data.value: Using AAPT is not supported in Xamarin.Android projects that target .NET 6 or higher. Please enable 'Use incremental Android packaging system (aapt2)' in the Visual Studio project property pages or edit the project file in a text editor and set the 'AndroidUseAapt2' MSBuild property to 'true'.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: AAPT, Android, AndroidUseAapt2, true.

data.name: XA1027
data.value: The 'EnableProguard' MSBuild property is set to 'true' and the 'AndroidLinkTool' MSBuild property is empty, so 'AndroidLinkTool' will default to 'proguard'.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: 'EnableProguard', 'true', 'AndroidLinkTool', 'proguard'

data.name: XA1028
data.value: The 'AndroidEnableProguard' MSBuild property is set to 'true' and the 'AndroidLinkTool' MSBuild property is empty, so 'AndroidLinkTool' will default to 'proguard'.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: 'AndroidEnableProguard', 'true', 'AndroidLinkTool', 'proguard'

data.name: XA1029
data.value: The 'AotAssemblies' MSBuild property is deprecated. Edit the project file in a text editor to remove this property, and use the 'RunAOTCompilation' MSBuild property instead.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: 'AotAssemblies', 'RunAOTCompilation'

data.name: XA1030
data.value: The 'RunAOTCompilation' MSBuild property is only supported when trimming is enabled. Edit the project file in a text editor to set 'PublishTrimmed' to 'true' for this build configuration.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: 'RunAOTCompilation', 'PublishTrimmed'

data.name: XA1031
data.value: The 'AndroidHttpClientHandlerType' property value '{0}' must derive from '{1}'. Please change the value to an assembly-qualifed type name which inherits from '{1}' or remove the property completely.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: 'AndroidHttpClientHandlerType', {0} - The value of the property. {1} - A type from which the AndroidHttpClientHandlerType should derive .

data.name: XA1031_HCH
data.value: The 'AndroidHttpClientHandlerType' property value '{0}' must not derive from 'System.Net.Htt.HttpClientHandler'. Please change the value to an assembly-qualifed type name which inherits from 'System.Net.Http.HttpMessageHandler' or remove the property completely.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: 'AndroidHttpClientHandlerType', 'System.Net.Htt.HttpClientHandler', 'System.Net.Http.HttpMessageHandler', {0} - The value of the property.

data.name: XA1032
data.value: Failed to resolve '{0}' from '{1}'. Please check your `AndroidHttpClientHandlerType` setting.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: 'AndroidHttpClientHandlerType', {0} - The value of the property. {1} - The name of the assembly.

data.name: XA1033
data.value: Could not resolve '{0}'. Please check your `AndroidHttpClientHandlerType` setting.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: 'AndroidHttpClientHandlerType', {0} - The value of the property.

data.name: XA1034
data.value: Your project references '{0}' which uses the `_Microsoft.Android.Resource.Designer` assembly, but you do not have this feature enabled. Please set the `AndroidUseDesignerAssembly` MSBuild property to `true` in your project file.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: '_Microsoft.Android.Resource.Desinger', 'AndroidUseDesignerAssembly', 'true' {0} - The name of the assembly

data.name: XA1035
data.value: The 'BundleAssemblies' property is deprecated and it has no effect on the application build. Equivalent functionality is implemented by the 'AndroidUseAssemblyStore' and 'AndroidEnableAssemblyCompression' properties.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: 'BundleAssemblies', 'AndroidUseAssemblyStore', 'AndroidEnableAssemblyCompression'

data.name: XA1036
data.value: AndroidManifest.xml //uses-sdk/@android:minSdkVersion '{0}' does not match the $(SupportedOSPlatformVersion) value '{1}' in the project file (if there is no $(SupportedOSPlatformVersion) value in the project file, then a default value has been assumed). Either change the value in the AndroidManifest.xml to match the $(SupportedOSPlatformVersion) value, or remove the value in the AndroidManifest.xml (and add a $(SupportedOSPlatformVersion) value to the project file if it doesn't already exist).
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: AndroidManifest.xml, //uses-sdk/@android:minSdkVersion, $(SupportedOSPlatformVersion) {0} - The minimum SDK version number {1} - The SupportedOSPlatformVersion property value

data.name: XA2000
data.value: Use of AppDomain.CreateDomain() detected in assembly: {0}. .NET 6 and higher will only support a single AppDomain, so this API will no longer be available in Xamarin.Android once .NET 6 is released.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: AppDomain.CreateDomain(), AppDomain {0} - The name of the assembly

data.name: XA2000_gcParams_bridgeImpl
data.value: Support for the 'MONO_GC_PARAMS=bridge-implementation=old' value will be removed in .NET 7.

data.name: XA2001
data.value: Source file '{0}' could not be found.

data.name: XA2002_Framework
data.value: Can not resolve reference: `{0}`, referenced by {1}. Perhaps it doesn't exist in the Mono for Android profile?
data.comment: {0} - The name of the missing assembly {1} - The chain of references that causes a reference to the missing assembly, with > as the separator between items. Example: `System.Memory` > `System.Buffers`

data.name: XA2002_NuGet
data.value: Can not resolve reference: `{0}`, referenced by {1}. Please add a NuGet package or assembly reference for `{0}`, or remove the reference to `{2}`.
data.comment: {0} - The name of the missing assembly {1} - The chain of references that causes a reference to the missing assembly, with > as the separator between items. Example: `System.Memory` > `System.Buffers` {2} - The name of the first assembly in the chain of references. Example: System.Memory

data.name: XA2006
data.value: Could not resolve reference to '{0}' (defined in assembly '{1}') with scope '{2}'. When the scope is different from the defining assembly, it usually means that the type is forwarded.
data.comment: {0} - The member name, such as a class name {1} - The assembly name {2} - The scope of the member, such as the name of a different assembly

data.name: XA2007
data.value: Exception while loading assemblies: {0}
data.comment: {0} - The exception message of the associated exception

data.name: XA2008
data.value: In referenced assembly {0}, Java.Interop.DoNotPackageAttribute requires non-null file name.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: Java.Interop.DoNotPackageAttribute {0} - The assembly name

data.name: APT2264
data.value: This could be caused by the project exceeding the Windows maximum path length limitation. See https://learn.microsoft.com/xamarin/android/errors-and-warnings/apt2264 for details.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated:

data.name: APT2265
data.value: This could be caused by the project having non-ASCII characters in its filename or path. See https://learn.microsoft.com/xamarin/android/errors-and-warnings/apt2265 for details.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated:

data.name: XA3001
data.value: Could not AOT the assembly: {0}
data.comment: The abbreviation "AOT" should not be translated.

data.name: XA3002
data.value: Invalid AOT mode: {0}
data.comment: The abbreviation "AOT" should not be translated.

data.name: XA3003
data.value: Could not strip IL of assembly: {0}
data.comment: The abbreviation "IL" should not be translated.

data.name: XA3004
data.value: Android NDK r10d is buggy and provides an incompatible x86_64 libm.so. See https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=161422.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: NDK, r10d, x86_64, libm.so "r10d" is the problematic version of the NDK. "x86_64" is the architecture of the libm.so file.

data.name: XA3005
data.value: The detected Android NDK version is incompatible with the targeted LLVM configuration. Please upgrade to NDK r10d or newer.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: NDK, LLVM, r10d "r10d" is the version of the NDK.

data.name: XA3006
data.value: Could not compile native assembly file: {0}{1}
data.comment: In this message, the term "assembly" means the low-level language that an assembler like `as` takes as input. (This is different from most of the other messages, where the term "assembly" means the file type that the C# compiler produces). The '{1}' placeholder is replaced with full output of the failed command, starting and ending with a newline.

data.name: XA3007
data.value: Could not link native shared library: {0}{1}
data.comment: The '{1}' placeholder is replaced with full output of the failed command, starting and ending with a newline.

data.name: XA4209
data.value: Failed to generate Java type for class: {0} due to {1}
data.comment: {0} - The managed type name {1} - The exception message of the associated exception

data.name: XA4210
data.value: Please add a reference to Mono.Android.Export.dll when using ExportAttribute or ExportFieldAttribute.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: Mono.Android.Export.dll, ExportAttribute, ExportFieldAttribute.

data.name: XA4211
data.value: AndroidManifest.xml //uses-sdk/@android:targetSdkVersion '{0}' is less than $(TargetFrameworkVersion) '{1}'. Using API-{2} for ACW compilation.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: AndroidManifest.xml, //uses-sdk/@android:targetSdkVersion , $(TargetFrameworkVersion), API-{2}, ACW {0} - The target SDK version number {1} - The target framework version number {2} - The API version number

data.name: XA4213
data.value: The type '{0}' must provide a public default constructor

data.name: XA4214
data.value: The managed type `{0}` exists in multiple assemblies: {1}. Please refactor the managed type names in these assemblies so that they are not identical.
data.comment: {0} - The managed type name {1} - Comma-separated list of all the assemblies where the managed type exists

data.name: XA4214_Result
data.value: References to the type `{0}` will refer to `{0}, {1}`.
data.comment: The phrase "`{0}, {1}`" does not need to be translated. {0} - The managed type name {1} - The name of the library that contains the type

data.name: XA4215
data.value: The Java type `{0}` is generated by more than one managed type. Please change the [Register] attribute so that the same Java type is not emitted.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: Java, [Register]

data.name: XA4215_Details
data.value: `{0}` generated by: {1}
data.comment: The two spaces indentation at the beginning of this message should be preserved in the translations where possible. {0} - The generated Java type name {1} - The managed type name

data.name: XA4216_SupportedOSPlatformVersion
data.value: The deployment target '{0}' is not supported (the minimum is '{1}'). Please increase the $(SupportedOSPlatformVersion) property value in your project file.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: Microsoft.Android, $(SupportedOSPlatformVersion) {0} - The value of $(SupportedOSPlatformVersion) {1} - The minimum $(SupportedOSPlatformVersion) supported by this version of the SDK

data.name: XA4216_MinSdkVersion
data.value: The deployment target '{0}' is not supported (the minimum is '{1}'). Please increase (or remove) the //uses-sdk/@android:minSdkVersion value in your AndroidManifest.xml.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: Microsoft.Android, //uses-sdk/@android:minSdkVersion, AndroidManifest.xml {0} - The value of //uses-sdk/@android:minSdkVersion {1} - The minimum $(SupportedOSPlatformVersion) supported by this version of the SDK

data.name: XA4216_TargetSdkVersion
data.value: AndroidManifest.xml //uses-sdk/@android:targetSdkVersion '{0}' is less than API-{1}, this configuration is not supported.

data.name: XA4218
data.value: Unable to find //manifest/application/uses-library at path: {0}
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: //manifest/application/uses-library

data.name: XA4219
data.value: Cannot find binding generator for language {0} or {1}.
data.comment: In this message, the term "binding" means a piece of code that makes it easy to access a certain kind of data that is originally stored outside of the target programming language, which is usually C#. {0} - The target programming language name, which is usually C# {1} - The default programming language name, which is also usually C#

data.name: XA4220
data.value: Partial class item '{0}' does not have an associated binding for layout '{1}'.
data.comment: In this message, the term "partial class item" means a .NET partial class. In this message, the term "binding" means a piece of code that makes it easy to access a certain kind of data that is originally stored outside of the target programming language, which is usually C#. In this mesage, the term "layout" means an Android UI layout. {1} - The path of the partial class file {0} - The name of the layout

data.name: XA4221
data.value: No layout binding source files were generated.
data.comment: In this message, the term "binding" means a piece of code that makes it easy to access a certain kind of data that is originally stored outside of the target programming language, which is usually C#. In this mesage, the term "layout" means an Android UI layout. In this message, the term "source files" means files that can be compiled, usually containing C# source code.

data.name: XA4222
data.value: No widgets found for layout ({0}).
data.comment: In this message, the term "widgets" means Android UI elements. In this mesage, the term "layout" means an Android UI layout. {0} - Semicolon-separated list of paths for the files that define the layout

data.name: XA4223
data.value: Malformed full class name '{0}'. Missing namespace.
data.comment: {0} - The class name

data.name: XA4224
data.value: Malformed full class name '{0}'. Missing class name.
data.comment: {0} - The class name

data.name: XA4225
data.value: Widget '{0}' in layout '{1}' has multiple instances with different types. The property type will be set to: {2}
data.comment: In this message, the term "widgets" means Android UI elements. In this mesage, the term "layout" means an Android UI layout. {0} - The name of the widget {1} - The name of the layout {2} - The type name that will be used, such as "object"

data.name: XA4226
data.value: Resource item '{0}' does not have the required metadata item '{1}'.
data.comment: {0} - The name of the Android layout resource file {1} - The name of the metadata item

data.name: XA4228
data.value: Unable to find specified //activity-alias/@android:targetActivity: '{0}'
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: //activity-alias/@android:targetActivity {0} - The specified targetActivity name

data.name: XA4229
data.value: Unrecognized `TransformFile` root element: {0}.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: TransformFile In this message, "root element" refers to the root element of an XML file. {0} - The name of the root element

data.name: XA4230
data.value: Error parsing XML: {0}
data.comment: {0} - The exception message and stack trace of the associated exception

data.name: XA4231
data.value: The Android class parser value '{0}' is deprecated and will be removed in a future version of Xamarin.Android. Update the project properties to use 'class-parse'.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: class-parse {0} - The name of the current class parser value

data.name: XA4232
data.value: The Android code generation target '{0}' is deprecated and will be removed in a future version of Xamarin.Android. Update the project properties to use 'XAJavaInterop1'.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: XAJavaInterop1 {0} - The name of the current code generation target

data.name: XA4300
data.value: Native library '{0}' will not be bundled because it has an unsupported ABI. Move this file to a directory with a valid Android ABI name such as 'libs/armeabi-v7a/'.
data.comment: In this message, the term "bundled" is a short way of saying "included into the final application package." The following are literal names and should not be translated: ABI, 'libs/armeabi-v7a/' {0} - The file path

data.name: XA4301
data.value: APK already contains the item {0}; ignoring.
data.comment: The abbreviation "APK" should not be translated. {0} - The file name.

data.name: XA4301_ABI
data.value: Cannot determine ABI of native library '{0}'. Move this file to a directory with a valid Android ABI name such as 'libs/armeabi-v7a/'.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: ABI, 'libs/armeabi-v7a/' {0} - The file path

data.name: XA4301_ABI_NuGet
data.value: Cannot determine ABI of native library '{0}'. Remove the '{1}' NuGet package, or notify the library author.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: ABI, NuGet {0} - The native library file path {1} - Either the name of the NuGet package or a path to the native library

data.name: XA4301_ABI_Ignoring
data.value: Could not determine ABI of some native libraries. Ignoring those: {0}
data.comment: The abbreviation "ABI" should not be translated. {0} - Comma-separated list of the ignored library file names.

data.name: XA4302
data.value: Unhandled exception merging `AndroidManifest.xml`: {0}
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: `AndroidManifest.xml` {0} - The exception message of the associated exception

data.name: XA4303
data.value: Error extracting resources from "{0}": {1}
data.comment: {0} - The file name {1} - The exception message of the associated exception

data.name: XA4304
data.value: ProGuard configuration file '{0}' was not found.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: ProGuard

data.name: XA4305
data.value: Multidex is enabled, but `$(_AndroidMainDexListFile)` is empty.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: Multidex, $(_AndroidMainDexListFile)

data.name: XA4305_File_Missing
data.value: Multidex is enabled, but the `$(_AndroidMainDexListFile)` file '{0}' does not exist.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: Multidex, $(_AndroidMainDexListFile)

data.name: XA4306
data.value: R8 does not support `@(MultiDexMainDexList)` files when android:minSdkVersion >= 21
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: R8, @(MultiDexMainDexList), android:minSdkVersion

data.name: XA4307
data.value: Invalid ProGuard configuration file. {0}
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: ProGuard {0} - The error message returned by the ProGuard tool.

data.name: XA4308
data.value: Failed to generate type maps

data.name: XA4309
data.value: 'MultiDexMainDexList' file '{0}' does not exist.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: MultiDexMainDexList

data.name: XA4310
data.value: `{0}` file `{1}` could not be found.
data.comment: {0} - The MSBuildProperty which contains the file name value. {1} - The value of the MSBuildProperty. Normally a filename.

data.name: XA4311
data.value: The application won't contain the paired Wear package because the Wear application package APK is not created yet. If building on the command line, be sure to build the "SignAndroidPackage" target.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: Wear, APK, SignAndroidPackage "Wear" is a short version of the full product name "Wear OS" and so should not be translated.

data.name: XA4312
data.value: Referencing the Android Wear application project '{0}' from an Android application project is deprecated and will no longer be supported in a future version of Xamarin.Android. Remove the Android Wear application project reference from the Android application project and distribute the Wear application as a standalone application instead.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: Android Wear, Android, Wear. {0} - The referenced Android Wear project.

data.name: XA4313
data.value: The built-in '{0}' reference has been deprecated. Remove the '{0}' reference from your project and add the '{1}' NuGet package instead.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: {0} - The Assembly name which is deprecated {1} - A Nuget package name.

data.name: XA4314
data.value: `{0}` is empty. A value for `{0}` should be provided.
data.comment: {0} - The MSBuildProperty which contains a value.

data.name: XA5101
data.value: Missing Android NDK toolchains directory '{0}'. Please install the Android NDK.
data.comment: {0} - The path of the missing directory

data.name: XA5101_C_Compiler
data.value: C compiler for target {0} was not found. Tried paths: "{1}"
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: C {0} - The target architecture, such as Arm, Arm64, or X86_64 {1} - Semicolon-separated list of the paths searched

data.name: XA5101_Toolchain
data.value: Toolchain directory for target {0} was not found.
data.comment: {0} - The target architecture, such as Arm, Arm64, or X86_64

data.name: XA5102
data.value: Conversion from assembly to native code failed. Exit code {0}
data.comment: In this message, the term "assembly" means the low-level language that an assembler like `as` takes as input. (This is different from most of the other messages, where the term "assembly" means the file type that the C# compiler produces.) {0} - The exit code number

data.name: XA5103
data.value: NDK C compiler exited with an error. Exit code {0}
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: NDK, C {0} - The exit code number

data.name: XA5104
data.value: Could not locate the Android NDK. Please make sure the Android NDK is installed in the Android SDK Manager, or if using a custom NDK path, please ensure the $(AndroidNdkDirectory) MSBuild property is set to the custom path.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: $(AndroidNdkDirectory)

data.name: XA5105
data.value: Toolchain utility '{0}' for target {1} was not found. Tried in path: "{2}"
data.comment: {0} - The missing utility name, such as gcc or clang {1} - The target architecture, such as Arm, Arm64, or X86_64 {2} - The path of the directory that was searched

data.name: XA5201
data.value: NDK linker exited with an error. Exit code {0}
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: NDK {0} - The exit code number

data.name: XA5205
data.value: Cannot find `{0}`. Please install the Android SDK Build-Tools package with the `{1}{2}tools{2}{3}` program.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: Android SDK Build-Tools, {1}{2}tools{2}{3} {0} - The missing tool name {1} - The parent directory {2} - The directory separator character {3} - The installer program name

data.name: XA5205_Lint
data.value: Cannot find `{0}` in the Android SDK. Please set its path via /p:LintToolPath.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: /p:LintToolPath {0} - The missing tool name

data.name: XA5207
data.value: Could not find android.jar for API level {0}. This means the Android SDK platform for API level {0} is not installed. Either install it in the Android SDK Manager ({2}), or change the Xamarin.Android project to target an API version that is installed. ({1} missing.)
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: android.jar {0} - The API level name {1} - The expected path of the android.jar file {2} - The menu location in Visual Studio that can be used to launch the Android SDK Manager

data.name: XA5207_SDK_Manager_VSCode
data.value: Tools > Open Android SDK Manager...
data.comment: This string is the location of a menu command in Visual Studio for Mac.

data.name: XA5207_SDK_Manager_Windows
data.value: Tools > Android > Android SDK Manager...
data.comment: This string is the location of a menu command in Visual Studio.

data.name: XA5207_SDK_Manager_CLI
data.value: Tools > Android > Android SDK Manager...
data.comment: This string is the location of a menu command in Visual Studio.

data.name: XA5211
data.value: Embedded Wear app package name differs from handheld app package name ({0} != {1}).
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: Wear "Wear" is a short version of the full product name "Wear OS" and so should not be translated. In this message, the term "handheld app" means "app for handheld devices." {0} - The Wear app package name {1} - The handheld app package name

data.name: XA5213
data.value: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError. Consider increasing the value of $(JavaMaximumHeapSize). Java ran out of memory while executing '{0} {1}'
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError, $(JavaMaximumHeapSize) {0} - The tool name {1} - The command line arguments used for the tool

data.name: XA5300_Android_Platforms
data.value: No Android platforms installed at '{0}'. Please install an SDK Platform with the `{1}{2}tools{2}{3}` program.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: SDK Platform, {1}{2}tools{2}{3} {0} - Android SDK platforms directory path {1} - Android SDK directory path {2} - The directory separator character {3} - The Android SDK installer program name

data.name: XA5300_Android_SDK
data.value: The Android SDK directory could not be found. Install the Android SDK by following the instructions at: https://aka.ms/dotnet-android-install-sdk To use a custom SDK path for a command line build, set the 'AndroidSdkDirectory' MSBuild property to the custom path.
data.comment: The following terms should not be translated: AndroidSdkDirectory

data.name: XA5300_Java_SDK
data.value: The Java SDK directory could not be found. Install the Java SDK by following the instructions at: https://aka.ms/dotnet-android-install-sdk To use a custom JDK path for a command line build, set the 'JavaSdkDirectory' MSBuild property to the custom path.
data.comment: The following terms should not be translated: JavaSdkDirectory

data.name: XA5301
data.value: Failed to generate Java type for class: {0} due to MAX_PATH: {1}
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: MAX_PATH. {0} - The managed type name {1} - The exception message of the associated exception

data.name: XA5302
data.value: Two processes may be building this project at once. Lock file exists at path: {0}

data.name: XA_Manifest_AutoGenerated_Header
data.value: This code was generated by a tool. It was generated from {0} Changes to this file may cause incorrect behavior and will be lost if the contents are regenerated.
data.comment: {0} - The path of the template file.

data.name: XA4233
data.value: The <AndroidNamespaceReplacement> for '{0}' does not specify a 'Replacement' attribute.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: <AndroidNamespaceReplacement> {0} - The AndroidNamespaceReplacement MSBuild value.

data.name: XA_Directory_Is_From
data.value: Directory '{0}' is from '{1}'.
data.comment: {0} - A Directory Path. {1} - A Filename.

data.name: XA8000
data.value: Could not find Android Resource '{0}'. Please update @(AndroidResource) to add the missing resource.
data.comment: {0} - An Android Resource Identifier.

data.name: XA4234
data.value: '<{0}>' item '{1}' is missing required metadata '{2}'
data.comment: {0} - The MSBuild ItemGroup Item name {1} - The MSBuild Item ItemSpec {2} - The omitted MSBuild Item metadata attribute

data.name: XA4235
data.value: Maven artifact specification '{0}' is invalid. The correct format is 'group_id:artifact_id'.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: Maven, group_id, artifact_id {0} - A Maven artifact specification

data.name: XA4236
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: Maven {0} - Maven artifact group id {1} - Maven artifact id {2} - The .jar filename we tried to download {3} - The HttpClient reported download exception message {4} - The .aar filename we tried to download {5} - The HttpClient provided download exception message

data.name: XA4237
data.value: Cannot download POM file for Maven artifact '{0}:{1}'. - {2}: {3}
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: POM, Maven {0} - Maven artifact group id {1} - Maven artifact id {2} - The .pom filename we tried to download {3} - The HttpClient reported download exception message

data.name: XA4238
data.value: Cannot download parent POM file for Maven artifact '{0}:{1}'. - {2}: {3}
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: POM, Maven {0} - Maven artifact group id {1} - Maven artifact id {2} - The .pom filename we tried to download {3} - The HttpClient reported download exception message

data.name: XA4239
data.value: Unknown Maven repository: '{0}'.
data.comment: The following are literal names and should not be translated: Maven {0} - User supplied Maven repository type
